definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Put together, their information should have been of inestimable value to Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 他們的信息和在一起，對莫斯科具有不可估量的價值。

sentences.english: For civilians, the impact would incalculable.
sentences.chinese: 對於平民，這項研究成果更是具有不可估量的作用。

sentences.english: The inestimable value of our Federal Union is felt and acknowledged by all.
sentences.chinese: 我們聯邦聯盟的不可估量的價值爲衆人所感受和認可。

sentences.english: Although a few words, but The role of such incentives are inestimable.
sentences.chinese: 雖然寥寥數語，但這樣激勵所起的作用是不可估量的。

sentences.english: What is likely to remain, however, is his inestimable popularity.
sentences.chinese: 但是，不變的仍然是他不可估量的聲望。

sentences.english: The doer recognizes his own and his neighbor's inestimable worth simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 施者會同時認知到他自己與鄰人不可估量的價值。

sentences.english: The intangible cultural heritages are unfathomably potential and valuable.
sentences.chinese: 非物質文化遺產具有不可估量的潛能和價值。

sentences.english: But this mountain has the inestimable influence to the world climate.
sentences.chinese: 而該山對世界氣候有着不可估量的影響。

sentences.english: The political implications of this case are inestimable.
sentences.chinese: 這個案子的政治影響是不可估量的。
而它所產生的影響也是不可估量的。

definition: it goes without saying/it is self-evident
it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...
from this, it can be seen that...
a tiny bit/very little/next to nothing (idiom)
